intro: Fimbristylis miliacea subsp. koidzumiana, commonly known as the Koidzumi sedge, is a flowering plant species native to Southeast Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland or marshy environments. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered spikelets that are characteristic of the Cyperaceae family. It has a fibrous root system and is often found in disturbed or nutrient-rich soils. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and small vertebrates.
